page.title: 14R.A.F.Finningley Today.
page.content: In 1936 an R.A.F. station was built on previously agricultural land.The station badge features a rose and sprig of oak because R.A.F. Finningley originally lay across the border of Yorkshire and Nottinghamshire. It has had changing roles over the years,but Finningley is now a teaching station,the home of 6 Flying Training School. It is a large station with a population of about 5000 including families.The Estates office maintains 114 officers' & 414 Airmen's married quarters.There is a C.of E.church, C.S.F.church,& R.C.church,each with resident chaplain. Centrally there is a Naafi & petrol station.Activities available include Wives' & Youth Clubs,P.E.facilities,& woodwork,computer,judo,motor,theatre & camera clubs.
